channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2024031410
item.description:
Report X-2024031410

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-01T03:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-20
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A class 3 shipment was presented to the MEMH spill office with an odor. While investigating the shipment the spill agent discovered that one of the three paint cans had spilled it's contents from the lid. All three had positve closure rings on. The contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024031402
item.description:
Report X-2024031402

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-21
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found with a minor leakage and was placed into a plastic tote to mitigate any additional spillage. Tote was then transferred to the HazMat station for further inspection. DescribePack: The box had several wet patches and a minor leakage. Two of the bottles had their necks crushed in which resulted in loose caps and a leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a plastic tote to mitigate any additional spillage.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found with one end of the box soaked in bleach and leaking. Package was placed into a plastic tote to mitigate any additional spillage and transferred to the HazMat station for further inspection. DescribePack: One end of the box was soaked in bleach that it was ripping apart. One of the bottles was bent in which resulted in a loose cap and leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a plastic tote to mitigate any additional spillage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found with a leakage and placed into a plastic tote to mitigate any additional spillage. Package was than transferred to the HazMat station for further inspection after discovering that the product was regulated. DescribePack: One edge of the box was covered in bleach stain and had a leakage. Two of the boxes looked to bent in with loosened cap which resulted in a leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a tote to mitigate any additional spillage.

item.description:

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: LEAKING PACKAGE APPEARS TO HAVE BEEN DISCOVERED BY DRIVER WHILE IN TRANSIT TO DELIVERY. BROUGHT BACK TO STATION FOR PROCESSING. DescribePack: TWO BOTTLES IN PACKAGE. ONE BOTTLE IN BOTTOM OF BOX ON ITS SIDE. THE OTHER BOTTLE UPRIGHT ON TOP OF FIRST BOTTLE. LOOSE LID ON BOTTOM BOTTLE ALLOWED CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE PLACED IN LINED CONTAINER

item.title: Report X-2024031328
item.description:
Report X-2024031328

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-21
  • City: MOUNT JULIET
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE APPEARED WET WHILE COMING DOWN BELT FOR VAN LOAD. PACKAGE WAS REMOVED FROM IC BELT AND PLACED IN TOTE. DescribePack: CAP ON INNER PACKING WAS NOT SEALED/SEATED PROPERLY CAUSING A SLOW INNER LEAK DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE PLACED IN TOTE AND MOVED TO HAZMAT CAGE UNDER FAN IN UPRIGHT POSITION TO AVOID MORE LEAKAGE AND DISIPATE THE FUMES.

I found the hazmat laying Sidways inside the trailer I contained the package in a hazmat bucket and bag. DescribePack: One Can had been crushed along the top and sides which caused it to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA was on scene as package was unloaded and took immediate action to mitigate.

item.title: Report X-2024031038
item.description:
Report X-2024031038

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-27T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-22
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 03/22/2024 at approximatley 0032, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 281407 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a paint spill. The shipment consisted of 12 fiberboard boxes, each containing 4, 4-Liter cans of paint. In the offending package, one of the cans appeared to leak due to a loose security ring, resulting in spillage. The 11 unharried packages continued in transport to destination and the offending package was held, awaiting an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

item.title: Report E-2024030305
item.description:
Report E-2024030305

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-14
  • City: DANDRIDGE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING UNLOADING OPERATIONS, UNIT UNLOADING PUMP CAUSE OVER PRESSURISING SYSTEM RESULTING IN MATERIAL RELEASE FROM PUMP HOUSING IN UNLOADING LINES. UNLOADING OPERATIONS WERE HAULTED. SPILL WAS CLEANED UP BY PLANT PERSONELL.
